intro: Cyrtidium, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silver vine, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. These plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Australia, and the Pacific Islands. Cyrtidium species are characterized by their glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or cream-colored flowers. They are often grown as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage and ease of care. Some species are also used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
